page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY,MANOR FARM
page.content: BARNHORNE MANOR FARM DATES BACK TO THE TIME OF KING OFFA IN 750 AD,GRANTED TO THE BISHOP OF SELSEY.SINCE THEN THERE HAS ALWAYS BEEN A LORD OF THE MANOR, THOUGH THE PRESENT"LORD"IS FEMALE. THE HOUSE DATES BACK TO TUDOR TIMES WITH LATER ADDITIONS.IT STARTED AS OBLONG, HAD AN'L'SHAPED WING ADDED,THEN LASTLY A CRESCENT-SHAPED CONSERVATORY.THE CHIMNEYS ARE TALL TUDOR STYLE,TO ACCOMODATE THE ONCE-THATCHED ROOF,NOW REPLACED BY SLATE. PEACOCKS ROAM THE GARDEN,4 FULLY GROWN AND 6 BABIES.MICE FOXES,RATS,MOLES,BADGERS AND RABBITS ARE ALL PESTS,BUT NO TRAPS ARE LAID AS THE OWNER LIKES TO SEE NATURE ALL AROUND HER,MUCH TO HER GARDENER'S DISGUST.THERE IS A TALL GARDEN WALL OF NATURAL FLINT,WITH"MOON DOORS" AND WINDOWS IN IT,PROBABLY BUILT IN THE EARLY 1800'S.RABBITS WERE NIBBLING GRASS,LETTUCE AND CARROT TOPS.
